author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 11. Valāhakavagga
segments.en: 11. Clouds

segments.pli: 108. Balībaddasutta
segments.en: 108. Oxen

segments.pli: “Cattārome, bhikkhave, balībaddā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of oxen.

segments.pli: Katame cattāro?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Sagavacaṇḍo no paragavacaṇḍo, paragavacaṇḍo no sagavacaṇḍo, sagavacaṇḍo ca paragavacaṇḍo ca, neva sagavacaṇḍo no paragavacaṇḍo—
segments.en:
1. One hostile to its own herd, not others;
  2. one hostile to other herds, not its own;
  3. one hostile to both its own herd and others; and
  4. one hostile to neither its own herd nor others.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro balībaddā.
segments.en: These are the four kinds of oxen.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cattāro balībaddūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: In the same way, these four people similar to oxen are found in the world.

segments.pli: Katame cattāro?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Sagavacaṇḍo no paragavacaṇḍo, paragavacaṇḍo no sagavacaṇḍo, sagavacaṇḍo ca paragavacaṇḍo ca, neva sagavacaṇḍo no paragavacaṇḍo.
segments.en:
1. One hostile to their own herd, not others;
  2. one hostile to other herds, not their own;
  3. one hostile to both their own herd and others; and
  4. one hostile to neither their own herd nor others.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo sagavacaṇḍo hoti, no paragavacaṇḍo?
segments.en: And how is a person hostile to their own herd, not others?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sakaparisaṃ ubbejetā hoti, no paraparisaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a person intimidates their own followers, not the followers of others.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo sagavacaṇḍo hoti, no paragavacaṇḍo.
segments.en: That’s how a person is hostile to their own herd, not others.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, balībaddo sagavacaṇḍo, no paragavacaṇḍo;
segments.en: That person is like an ox that’s hostile to its own herd, not others.

segments.pli: tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo paragavacaṇḍo hoti, no sagavacaṇḍo?
segments.en: And how is a person hostile to other herds, not their own?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo paraparisaṃ ubbejetā hoti, no sakaparisaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a person intimidates the followers of others, not their own. …

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo paragavacaṇḍo hoti, no sagavacaṇḍo.
Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, balībaddo paragavacaṇḍo, no sagavacaṇḍo;
tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo sagavacaṇḍo ca hoti paragavacaṇḍo ca?
segments.en: And how is a person hostile to both their own herd and others?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sakaparisaṃ ubbejetā hoti paraparisañca.
segments.en: It’s when a person intimidates their own followers and the followers of others. …

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo sagavacaṇḍo ca hoti paragavacaṇḍo ca.
Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, balībaddo sagavacaṇḍo ca paragavacaṇḍo ca;
tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo neva sagavacaṇḍo hoti no paragavacaṇḍo?
segments.en: And how is a person hostile to neither their own herd nor others?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo neva sakaparisaṃ ubbejetā hoti, no paraparisañca.
segments.en: It’s when a person doesn’t intimidate their own followers or the followers of others.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo neva sagavacaṇḍo hoti, no paragavacaṇḍo.
Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, balībaddo neva sagavacaṇḍo, no paragavacaṇḍo;
tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro balībaddūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
segments.en: These four people similar to oxen are found in the world.”

segments.pli: Aṭṭhamaṃ.

sections.title: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of oxen.
